high_level_goal: The user intends to prepare ingredients by retrieving vegetables, washing them, and chopping a zucchini into diced pieces.

steps.step_goal: Illuminate the environment to enable visual navigation.
steps.rationale: Illuminating the room is physically required to change the environment's affordance from dark to visible, allowing the agent to identify and navigate to the kitchen resources safely.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The switch must be mechanically operable to close the electrical circuit.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Completing the circuit powers the light fixtures, changing the visibility state of the room.

steps.counterfactual_challenge_question: If the switch mechanism was jammed or the circuit lacked power, what would be the physical result of the pressing action?
steps.expected_challenge_outcome: The button would not depress or the light would not activate, leaving the room dark and preventing visual navigation.

failure_reflecting.reason: The agent might fumble in the darkness, missing the specific button hotspot or failing to apply sufficient normal force.
failure_reflecting.recovery_strategy: Slide the hand across the wall panel to tactilely locate the button contours before re-attempting the press.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Initiation: The right hand makes contact with the light switch panel to locate the button.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The switch surface must be exposed to allow the hand to apply force.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The hand has established physical control over the switch surface.

hotspot.description: The specific push-button on the wall-mounted switch panel.
hotspot.mechanism: The hand aligns with the button surface to prepare for force application.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Completion: The button is fully depressed by the finger, triggering the light to turn on.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The button mechanism must yield to pressure to actuate the switch.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The mechanical actuation closes the circuit, causing the lights to illuminate the room.

hotspot.description: The depressed push-button on the switch panel.
hotspot.mechanism: Applying normal force compresses the internal spring mechanism to close the electrical contact.

steps.rationale: The agent requires the raw ingredients (zucchini and carrot) stored in the refrigerator to proceed with the washing and chopping tasks defined in the subsequent steps.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The vegetables must be physically accessible within the open fridge drawer to be picked up.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The vegetables are now held by the agent and removed from their storage location, ready for transport.

steps.counterfactual_challenge_question: If the refrigerator drawer containing the vegetables was jammed shut, could the agent complete the retrieval?
steps.expected_challenge_outcome: No, the physical barrier of the jammed drawer would prevent the agent's hand from reaching and grasping the vegetables.

failure_reflecting.reason: The agent might fumble the grasp on the loose vegetables (zucchini and carrot) while lifting them, causing them to fall back into the drawer or onto the floor.
failure_reflecting.recovery_strategy: Re-grasp the fallen vegetables securely and attempt to lift them out of the fridge again.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: The agent's right hand reaches into the crisper drawer and firmly grasps the zucchini and carrot.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The vegetables are visible and unobstructed in the drawer, allowing the hand to form a grip.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The friction grasp established by the hand allows the vegetables to be lifted against gravity.

hotspot.description: The mid-section surfaces of the zucchini and carrot.
hotspot.mechanism: Friction grasp applied by the fingers and palm to secure the objects for lifting.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: The agent fully withdraws the vegetables from the refrigerator interior and begins to move away.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The objects must be free to move across the fridge threshold without obstruction.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The vegetables have successfully crossed the boundary of the storage container.

hotspot.description: The surface of the vegetables being held.
hotspot.mechanism: Continuous grip force maintains control of the objects during transport out of the fridge.

steps.step_goal: Wash the vegetables at the sink.
steps.rationale: Cleaning the vegetables is a necessary hygiene step to remove surface dirt and contaminants before chopping and cooking.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The tap must be active and releasing a stream of water to enable the rinsing action.
The vegetables must be held securely to be manipulated under the water stream.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Exposure to the running water removes surface debris and wets the skin of the vegetables.

steps.counterfactual_challenge_question: If the water pressure were extremely low (just a dribble), would this step be effective?
steps.expected_challenge_outcome: No, the mechanical force of the flowing water is required to effectively rinse away dirt particles; a dribble would be insufficient.

failure_reflecting.reason: The water stream might deflect off the curved surface of the vegetables, causing splashing onto the counter.
failure_reflecting.recovery_strategy: Lower the hands deeper into the sink basin or adjust the angle of the vegetable to direct the splash downwards.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Initiation: The agent positions the first vegetable (zucchini) under the running water stream to begin rinsing.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The tap must be active and releasing a stream of water to enable the rinsing action.
The vegetables must be held securely to be manipulated under the water stream.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Exposure to the running water removes surface debris and wets the skin of the vegetables.

hotspot.description: The outer skin/surface of the zucchini positioned in the water flow.
hotspot.mechanism: Fluid flow exerts shear force to remove contaminants from the object surface.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Completion: The agent finishes rinsing the second vegetable (carrot), ensuring all items are cleaned.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The tap must be active and releasing a stream of water to enable the rinsing action.
The vegetables must be held securely to be manipulated under the water stream.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Exposure to the running water removes surface debris and wets the skin of the vegetables.

hotspot.description: The outer skin/surface of the carrot positioned in the water flow.
hotspot.mechanism: Fluid flow exerts shear force to remove contaminants from the object surface.

steps.step_goal: Place vegetables on the cutting board.
steps.rationale: Placing the vegetables down is necessary to free the agent's hands for subsequent tasks, such as handling the knife, and to position the ingredients on a stable surface for cutting.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The surface must be flat and stable to receive the vegetables.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Releasing the vegetables frees the hands for the next step.
The vegetables are now resting on a stable surface.

steps.counterfactual_challenge_question: If the kitchen counter surface were slanted or extremely slippery, what would happen when placing the vegetables?
steps.expected_challenge_outcome: The vegetables would likely roll off or slide away, failing to remain in a stable position for preparation.

failure_reflecting.reason: The agent placed the vegetables on the counter adjacent to the cutting board rather than on the board itself.
failure_reflecting.recovery_strategy: Pick up the vegetables again and move them directly onto the green cutting board.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Initiation: The agent holds the washed vegetables over the sink area, transitioning them toward the placement surface.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The vegetables are held and ready to be moved to the surface.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Hands are currently engaging the object to move it.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Completion: The vegetables are resting on the wooden counter surface next to the cutting board, and the hands have released them.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The counter provides a stable surface for the placed objects.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Gravity holds the vegetables against the stable surface after release.

steps.step_goal: Retrieve the knife from the drawer.
steps.rationale: A sharp tool is mechanically required to sever the fibers of the vegetables. The agent visually locates the knife on the countertop and retrieves it to enable the subsequent chopping task, fulfilling the goal of acquiring the tool despite the location deviation.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The knife handle is exposed on the counter, free of obstructions, and oriented for a right-handed grasp.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The knife moves with the agent's hand and is positioned for cutting.

steps.counterfactual_challenge_question: If the knife handle were covered by the cutting board, could the agent immediately retrieve it?
steps.expected_challenge_outcome: No, the agent would first need to move the cutting board to expose the handle affordance for a safe grasp.

failure_reflecting.reason: The agent could fail to establish sufficient friction if the handle is wet or greasy, causing a slip.
failure_reflecting.recovery_strategy: Dry the hand and handle, then re-attempt the grasp with higher grip force.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Initiation: The right hand contacts the knife handle and establishes a grasp.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The handle is physically accessible on the surface.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: Physical contact is made to enable force transfer.

hotspot.description: The grey handle of the knife.
hotspot.mechanism: Friction grasp is applied by the fingers wrapping around the handle.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Completion: The knife is lifted off the countertop, fully controlled by the hand.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: A stable grip allows for lifting.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The object is now supported by the hand against gravity and moves with the agent.

hotspot.description: The knife handle enclosed in the palm.
hotspot.mechanism: Upward lifting force overcomes gravity and surface friction.

steps.rationale: Cutting the zucchini into smaller, diced pieces is necessary to prepare it for cooking as specified in the recipe, ensuring even cooking and appropriate texture.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The vegetable must be firm yet yield to the knife blade to be sliced without crushing.
The tool must have a sharp edge to penetrate the zucchini skin and flesh efficiently.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The physical shearing force of the knife transforms the whole vegetable into multiple smaller pieces.

steps.counterfactual_challenge_question: If the zucchini was frozen solid, how would that affect the slicing process?
steps.expected_challenge_outcome: The knife would likely fail to penetrate or slice smoothly, potentially slipping off the hard surface due to the change in material cuttablity.

failure_reflecting.reason: The knife might slip on the smooth skin of the zucchini, causing uneven cuts or injury.
failure_reflecting.recovery_strategy: Reposition the holding hand to use a claw grip for stability and safety, and apply controlled sawing pressure.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Initiation: The knife makes contact with the whole zucchini to begin the first slicing motion.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The zucchini is intact and positioned on the board, ready to be severed.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The force applied by the knife is actively separating the material.

hotspot.description: The top surface of the zucchini where the knife blade aligns for the cut.
hotspot.mechanism: Downward pressure and shearing force from the knife blade initiate material separation.

critical_frames.action_state_change_description: Completion: The knife finishes cutting through a stack of slices, resulting in diced pieces.

causal_precondition_on_affordance.reasons: The zucchini must already be in slices (rounds) to be arranged for the final dicing cut.

causal_effect_on_affordance.reasons: The knife has successfully severed the stacked slices into smaller, diced segments.

hotspot.description: The stack of zucchini slices under the knife blade.
hotspot.mechanism: The blade passes completely through the material to contact the board, ensuring separation.
